subject: Using JUnit with Java Web Start
msgSnippet: I have tried to use Java Web Start to download JUnit.jar and run the Swing TestRunner.  The application downloads but the GUI does not appear.  The jnlp file
messageBody:
I have tried to use Java Web Start to download JUnit.jar and run the
Swing TestRunner. The application downloads but the GUI does not
appear. The jnlp file I'm using is as follows

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<!-- JNLP File for DoJava Application -->
<jnlp

codebase ="http://localhost/"
href="DoJava.jnlp">
<information>
<title>Swing Application - DoJava</title>
<vendor>christina</vendor>
<description>Swing Application - DoJava</description>
<description kind="short">Swing Application -
DoJava</description>
<offline-allowed/>
</information>
<resources>
<j2se version="1.4"/>
<jar href = "junit.jar"/>
<jar href="dojava.jar"/>
<jar href="tests.jar"/>
</resources>
<application-desc main-class="junit.swingui.TestRunner"/>
</jnlp>

My tests are in tests.jar and the classes they are testing are in
dojava.jar

Actually, even trying to run tests when all the classes are in jar
files on the local machine (and in the classpath) is a bit iffy.
More often than not the application hangs, but in the case of using
web start it doesn't even get going. Any suggestions would be
appreciated.
